content: @Aman Arora I'm debating about https://github.com/rust-lang/rust/pull/86818/ -- the logic seems quite a bit more complicated -- it occurs to me that we don't necessarily need to support this option on Rust 2021.
I expect we will remove that option once rust 2021 ships
So this came up as an idea for letting user profile closures for perf optimization
But i fyou feel like this isn't a long lasting flag then there is no need to merge this
well, I saw this primarily as a "transition" thing
after the feature has been here a while, it's probably not that interesting to compare before/after
it may still be interesting to be able to just profile the size of closures overall
to help in identifying opportunities for optimization
my hunch would be that the best way to do that, though, would be to dump a json file that includes information about what is captured too
so someone can load it up and do analysis ("what would be the effect of different optimizations")
